summary: This document is a legal objection from T-Mobile regarding a demand for records related to a subscriber. T-Mobile outlines several reasons for their objection, including issues with personal service and jurisdiction, as well as the nature of the records requested.
keyFacts: T-Mobile objects to a legal demand for records citing multiple reasons including lack of personal service and jurisdiction.
The demand is described as overbroad and unduly burdensome.
Subscriber information for Metro by T-Mobile is maintained for approximately six months after account termination.
Call detail records for Metro by T-Mobile subscribers are stored for up to two years.
